  • Main

Main#

Script responsible for turning on the app and containing classes responsible for running simulations, managing queue, and functional GUI.

Main script can be found at the root folder of entire AutoFluent.

class Main.SimulationClass(simGeneralObject, simMeshObjectList, simTunnelObject, simSolverSett, simBoundarySett, simPostproSett, simParametersSett, simName, simStat='wait')#

Bases: object

Class containing all of simulation settings and responsible for starting individual simulation steps as individual threads.

Attributes:

states

Shotcuts fow various possible simulation states.

Methods:

__init__(simGeneralObject, ...[, simStat])

Constructs a simulation class with simulation settings as its atributes.

findSimID()

This function will automatically find a closest aviable ID number for simulation.

startMeshing()

Changes the simulation status to 'Meshing' and pushes the simulation settings to Mesher.StartFluentMeshing function which takes care of entire meshing workflow.

startMeshingThread()

Starts SimulationClass.startMeshing() method in new thread.

startSolver()

Changes the simulation status to 'Solving' and pushes the simulation settings to Solver.StartFluentSolver function which takes care of entire solver workflow.

startSolverThread()

Starts SimulationClass.startSolver() method in new thread.

startPostpro()

Changes the simulation status to 'Postprocessing' and pushes the simulation settings to Postproces.StartPostprocessing() function which takes care of entire postprocessing workflow.

startPostproThread()

Starts SimulationClass.startPostpro() method in new thread.
states = {'dn': 'Done!', 'err': 'Error!!!', 'msh': 'Meshing', 'msh_dn': 'Meshing done!', 'post': 'Postprocessing', 'slv': 'Solving', 'slv_dn': 'Solved', 'wait': 'Waiting'}#

Shotcuts fow various possible simulation states.

__init__(simGeneralObject, simMeshObjectList, simTunnelObject, simSolverSett, simBoundarySett, simPostproSett, simParametersSett, simName, simStat='wait')#

Constructs a simulation class with simulation settings as its atributes.

findSimID()#

This function will automatically find a closest aviable ID number for simulation.

Returns:

(Int) ID number of simulation

startMeshing()#

Changes the simulation status to ‘Meshing’ and pushes the simulation settings to Mesher.StartFluentMeshing function which takes care of entire meshing workflow.

After meshing changes the simulation status to ‘Meshing Done’.

Returns:

(String) path to saved volumetric mesh

startMeshingThread()#

Starts SimulationClass.startMeshing() method in new thread.

Returns:

(Thread)

startSolver()#

Changes the simulation status to ‘Solving’ and pushes the simulation settings to Solver.StartFluentSolver function which takes care of entire solver workflow.

After solving changes the simulation status to ‘Solver Done’.

Returns:

(String) path to saved case file

startSolverThread()#

Starts SimulationClass.startSolver() method in new thread.

Returns:

(Thread)

startPostpro()#

Changes the simulation status to ‘Postprocessing’ and pushes the simulation settings to Postproces.StartPostprocessing() function which takes care of entire postprocessing workflow.

After postprocessing changes the simulation status to ‘Done’.

Returns:

True

startPostproThread()#

Starts SimulationClass.startPostpro() method in new thread.

Returns:

(Thread)

class Main.MainMenuButtons(master)#

Bases: CTkScrollableFrame

class that initialises the main menu buttons which redirect the user to given subcategories.

Methods:

__init__(master)

Construct a frame widget with the parent MASTER.
__init__(master)#

Construct a frame widget with the parent MASTER.

Valid resource names: background, bd, bg, borderwidth, class, colormap, container, cursor, height, highlightbackground, highlightcolor, highlightthickness, relief, takefocus, visual, width.

class Main.Queue(master, **kwargs)#

Bases: CTkFrame

Queue class manages the order of simulations in queue as well as a visualisation of queue in GUI.

Methods:

__init__(master, **kwargs)

Construct a frame widget with the parent MASTER.

updateSims(simList)

This method checks all simulations in queue and and assigns a propper status and colour based on simulation status.

insertSim(sim)

Inserts a new simulation (SimulationClass) to queue.

updateColour(simList)

Assigns a proper colour in queue based on simulation status.
__init__(master, **kwargs)#

Construct a frame widget with the parent MASTER.

Valid resource names: background, bd, bg, borderwidth, class, colormap, container, cursor, height, highlightbackground, highlightcolor, highlightthickness, relief, takefocus, visual, width.

updateSims(simList)#

This method checks all simulations in queue and and assigns a propper status and colour based on simulation status.

insertSim(sim)#

Inserts a new simulation (SimulationClass) to queue.

updateColour(simList)#

Assigns a proper colour in queue based on simulation status.

class Main.MainApp(fg_color=None, *args, **kwargs)#

Bases: CTk

A main CTKinter class that services all other TKinter classes and pushes simulation settings into queue.

Methods:

__init__([fg_color])

Return a new top level widget on screen SCREENNAME.

windows_init()

Initialises the Options Menus top scrolls buttons and inserts a ctk.CTkFrame class of options menu to each button.

reset_logging()

Resets the terminal redirecting back to python terminal.

redirect_logging()

Redirects the python terminal into a GUI terminal (read only).

browseFolders()

Opens the explorer window and puts the selected folder into a GeneralObject.workingDirectory attribute.

openHelp()

changeSegment(a)

Changes the simulation starting point and activates the GUI_Subclasses/GUI_General.General.activateDataInput() method.

Start()

Creates the SimulationsClass from current settings and pushes the simulation into a simulation queue.

QueueLoop()

Loop responsible for pushing simulations in the queue.

show_frame(cont)

Shows a frame of given ctk.CTkFrame class options menu.

getJsonSavePath()

Gets a .json file path from opened explorer window and writes current simulation settings into newly created .json file.

WriteSettToJson(Obj_list, file_path)

Writes all the provided Settings objects into a provided .json file.

browseJsonFiles()

Opens the explorer window and reads the selected .json settings file.

ReadSettJson(File_path)

Reads a provided .json file and loads the values into settings objects.
__init__(fg_color=None, *args, **kwargs)#

Return a new top level widget on screen SCREENNAME. A new Tcl interpreter will be created. BASENAME will be used for the identification of the profile file (see readprofile). It is constructed from sys.argv[0] without extensions if None is given. CLASSNAME is the name of the widget class.

windows_init()#

Initialises the Options Menus top scrolls buttons and inserts a ctk.CTkFrame class of options menu to each button.

If new options menu is desired, its ctk.CTkFrame class needs to be inserted into container bellow.

reset_logging()#

Resets the terminal redirecting back to python terminal.

redirect_logging()#

Redirects the python terminal into a GUI terminal (read only).

browseFolders()#

Opens the explorer window and puts the selected folder into a GeneralObject.workingDirectory attribute.

openHelp()#
changeSegment(a)#

Changes the simulation starting point and activates the GUI_Subclasses/GUI_General.General.activateDataInput() method.

Start()#

Creates the SimulationsClass from current settings and pushes the simulation into a simulation queue.

QueueLoop()#

Loop responsible for pushing simulations in the queue.

show_frame(cont)#

Shows a frame of given ctk.CTkFrame class options menu.

getJsonSavePath()#

Gets a .json file path from opened explorer window and writes current simulation settings into newly created .json file.

WriteSettToJson(Obj_list, file_path)#

Writes all the provided Settings objects into a provided .json file.

browseJsonFiles()#

Opens the explorer window and reads the selected .json settings file.

ReadSettJson(File_path)#

Reads a provided .json file and loads the values into settings objects.
